alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Madison River Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 7:41PM MST until February 23 at 12:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...The Madison and Beaverhead River Valleys. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Madison River Valley
